result.execSummary:
The defendant Hevane L Richards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court will not grant expungement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hevane L Richards

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:53 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to an amended charge of 4th degree sexual assault (940.225(3m)) with probation.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended charge of 4th degree sexual assault.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-6 months county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-30 days county jail, with credit for time served.  (TIME SERVED) sentence
-No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court will not grant expungement.

Court adjourned at 10:03 a.m.
State's
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
By Atty Barb Privat
Defendant's
for Discovery (Defendant's)
Status hearing at 03-08-2016 09:45 am

2:20 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing scheduled on 02/23.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 11:30 p.m.  Statement by Atty Privat regarding bond.  Statement by DA Christenson regarding bond.  Court denies the motion to modify bond.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 8, 2-016 at 8:45 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:26 p.m.
Status hearing at 02-22-2016 02:00 pm

NO Contact with H.M.K.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Warrant was cancelled on February 11, 2016 - talked with Sue at GLSO.
43
Preliminary hearing at 02-23-2016 01:00 pm

NO Contact with H.M.K.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:01 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant.  Court instructs the defendant in regards to the preliminary hearing and the time limits.  Statement by ADA regarding non-appearance.  Court will set for preliminary hearing.  Court instructs defendant regarding counsel and how to obtain counsel.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court modifies bond to $500.00 cash bond and same condition as before - NO Contact with H.M.K.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Court adjourned at 1:06 p.m.

Warrant sent down to GLSO on 12/22/2015.

8:45 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  NO Contact with H.M.K.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on December 22, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. and Status Hearing on December 15, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.  Court quashes any warrants.

Court adjourned at 8:48 a.m.
